citation.article-title: Fluorescent pseudomonads associated with the phyllosphere of grasses; Pseudomonas trivialis sp. nov., Pseudomonas poae sp. nov. and Pseudomonas congelans sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Pseudomonas poae sp. nov.
Pseudomonas poae (po′ae. Gr. n. poa grass; N.L. gen. n. poae of/from grass).
Cells are motile by one polar flagellum and are 2·5–3·3 μm long and about 0·8 μm wide.
Strains show a weak oxidase reaction.

In addition to the general description, the following substances are assimilated: 2-aminoethanol, β-hydroxybutyric acid, l-proline, l-histidine, dl-lactic acid, putrescine, quinic acid, succinaminic acid, sucrose, d-trehalose and Tween 40.

None of the strains assimilates γ-hydroxybutyric acid, d-cellobiose, i-erythritol, glucose 6-phosphate, dl-α-glycerol phosphate, glycyl l-aspartic acid, p-hydroxyphenylacetic acid, α-ketovaleric acid, d-sorbitol or l-rhamnose.

Gelatinase, casein hydrolysis and utilization of glycogen, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, α-d-glucose, d-psicose, monomethyl succinate, formic acid, α-hydroxybutyric acid, α-ketobutyric acid, glycyl l-glutamic acid, hydroxy-l-proline, l-ornithine, d-serine and dl-carnitine are strain-dependent.
The type strain, P 527/13T (=DSM 14936T=LMG 21465T), was isolated from the phyllosphere of grasses in Paulinenaue (Germany).
